poem:
Title: "In the Echoes of History"

From stained hands rise old ghosts,
Beseeching clarity amid chaos and loss.
Germany, grim guardian, stands, 
In the mirror of Holocaust memory,
Confronts shadows of a new massacre,
In Israel's pain, Palestine's horror.
Silent stands she in tangled regret, 
Haunted faces whisper, "Never Forget".
In the rubble of Gaza's strife,
Can we not summon a valorous life?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Germany’s murderous history should give it clarity about the Middle East. Instead, it is paralysed | John Kampfner Germany, more than any other country, is struggling to disentangle the horrors of the 7 October Hamas massacre in Israel, the subsequent death of more than 30,000 Palestinians and the demolition of Gaza, and the killing of aid workers, from the scale of the Holocaust more than eight decades earlier. History has come back to haunt Germany". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
